```{r 3.2 Function to inclusively count numbers between 5 and input parameter}

sumfun <- function (n) {
  sum(5:n)
}

print(sumfun(10))
print(sumfun(20))
print(sumfun(100))
```

```{r 3.3 Fibonacci}
#Create empty object 12 digits long
fib <- numeric(12)

#add first two entries manually
fib[1] <- 1
fib[2] <- 1

#Loop to add entries 3:n (n=12)
for (i in 3:12) {
  fib[i] <- sum(fib[i-1], fib[i-2])
}

#Print Fibonacci object
print(fib)

```

```{r 3.5 linear model}
#attach(cars)
#Get info on dataset
?cars

#Make linear model and show summary
model <- lm(dist~speed, cars)
summary(model)

#Generate output to answer the question
outputs <- round(summary(model)$coefficients[,1:2], 2)
print(outputs)
```

#Linear Model
Slope: 3.93
Intercept: -17.58

#Standard Errors
Intercept SE: 6.76
dist SE: 0.42

#Units:
Speed: mph
Stopping distance: feet

```{r 3.6 ggplot of lm}

linplot <- ggplot(data=model, aes(x=speed, y=dist)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, col='blue')
linplot
```

```{r 3.7 estimate of average reaction time}

#As speed increases, thinking time increases
#Thinking time is stopping distance (dist) - breaking distance
#breaking distance is proportional to speed^2
#Breaking distance is speed^2+interept
#s=d/t
#t=d/s
thinking_time <- lm(speed^2)

stopping_time <- cars$dist/cars$speed
x <- cars$speed^2
thinking <- lm(y~speed^2, cars)

summary(thinking)


thinkplot <- ggplot(data=cars, aes(x=speed, y=dist)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, formula=y~x^2, col='blue')
thinkplot

```
